snippet: Nearly 200 people have died in the last three weeks in fighting between members of the Salamat and the Messeiriya tribes, officials say.
abstract: United Nations officials confirm fighting between two Arab tribes in southwest Darfur; tribal leaders say nearly 200 have been killed over past three months despite peace treaty signed in July.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 200 people have died in the last three weeks in fighting between members of the Salamat and the Messeiriya tribes, officials say.

headline.main: Scores Killed in Tribal Clashes in Darfur
headline.print_headline: Sudan: Dozens Killed in Darfur Clashes

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
